intro: Opsanthe obtusifola, commonly known as the broad-leafed daphne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. The leaves are typically glossy and dark green, adding visual interest throughout the growing season.
